The Digital Review Jhave ~ Crimes Against Neurology

Crimes
Against
Neurology


Evading the 6th extinction
requires re-configuring
how we think.

tl dr;

Factory farms are implicated in the creation of pandemic viruses, climate change, and famine. Brain-machine-implantation research that relies on primates is neurologic neo-colonialism. Denial of moral agency, implied by animal usage in labs and as food, threatens not just animals and ecosystems, but human rights and ecosystem survival.


Retroactive Prelude


I had originally intended to write an essay about interaction design.

Theoretically, it would follow a trajectory through Heidegger, the GOMS Model, Lucy Suchman, Donna Haraway, Paul Dourish, Rosalind Picard, Pelle Ehn, and Shaowen Bardzell.

Practically, it would cover a spectrum from HCI’s orgins with Douglas Engelbart’s Mother of All Demos, to Ivan Sutherland, Myron Kreuger, Muriel Cooper, Natalie Jeremijenko, David Rokeby, and Char Davies; review many contemporary practitioners (like Micha Cárdenas, Suzanne Kite, and Sougwen Chung); and finish with an ethical consideration of future brain machine interface-implantations through an autopsy of NeuraLink as seen through neo-colonialist occupation of unceded neurological primate tissue during material testing phases.

Then COVID came.

What is this about?

It is about ethical failure. The futility of activism. An ongoing catastrophe. And the absurd circular complicity of appetite.

Climate Change

Our own deaths entangled with those of other species. The energy we use toxic to the earth.

Factory Farms

Bred, born, fed, and killed in a concentration camp. You never see sky. You never know family.

Nuclear War

Low weight, low yield, tactical weapons. Firing controlled by Ai. Sporadic errors.

Pandemics

Lockdown borders, patriotism, insular communities, and inequitable suffering.

Racism

is a prejudice or bias
towards the interests of members of one's own race
and against those of members
of other races.

“Whatever white people do not know about Negroes reveals, precisely and inexorably, what they do not know about themselves.”


James Baldwin. Letters from a Region in my Mind (1962)

9,000,000 PEOPLE Die Every Year of Malnutrition.


Compare a candle to a forest fire. Starvation is a forest fire of deaths, raging for decades, since slavery.

The COVID-19 pandemic is serious, response is necessary, yet it is a candle.

Why are hunger deaths not motivating proportionate coordinated global action? An ethics of proximity, similarity, and greed rules. Humans cognitively struggle to sustain empathy for groups outside of ideological awareness. The UN & WHO have for years been actively engaging with issue of hunger, and until a few years ago deaths were slowly declining, yet with the pandemic logic another famine looms.

We need an Ethics of Unified Relational Systems. Hunger is a racist issue.

WEHO: World Equal Health Organization

60,000,000,000 ANIMALS Die Every Year For Food.


Their crowded cages and battered bodies are the birthplace of zootopic viruses.


Vertebrates all have skin, sensory nerve receptors, a central nervous system, a sympathetic and parasympathetic system, neurotransmitters, pain perception, myelination, and a modularized brain.


Eat. Breath. Shit. Roam. Breed. Grow. Nurture. Play. Fight. Explore. Sleep. Die.


Structurally embodied sentience
Encaged in crowded barns
Mutating coronaviruses.

Speciesism

is a prejudice or bias
towards the interests of members of one's own species
and against those of members
of other species.

Peter Singer. Animal Liberation (1974)


Hunger
Is Not
Necessary


Most industrially-produced grain goes to biofuel and confined animal feedlots.


"The meat that we eat today overwhelmingly comes from genetically uniform, immunocompromised, and regularly drugged animals lodged by the tens of thousands into buildings or stacked cages – no matter how the meat is labelled."

Foer, J. S., & Gross, A. S. (2020, April 20). We have to wake up: Factory farms are breeding grounds for pandemics | Jonathan Safran Foer and Aaron S Gross. The Guardian.

"It is estimated that people who eat beef use 160 times more land, water and fuel resources to sustain their diets than their plant-based counterparts."

Animals
Undeniably
Suffer


60 billion vertebrae land animals
killed annually for food.



Our Perception
of the
Other


Smeared blind enemy-empathy constraints adjusted for survival over eons of tribal warfare may be ill-adapted for a world of networked Ai.

Humanipulated


Humanipulated organisms compromise a growing product category for industry research. Genetic ownership considers lifeforms as lacking in moral agency.

Oncogenic Neo-Capitalism
A Cancer Rainbow Mouse

"— We have developed the Cancer rainbow (Crainbow) mouse platform to generate user-defined, reliable, and multiplexed models of tumorigenesis in a single genetically tractable system." & "The Crainbow platform will decentralize mouse engineering thereby transforming mouse model development into a user-defined commodity"

Caron, M. (n.d.). A Cancer Rainbow Mouse for Simultaneous Assessment of Multiple Oncogenes. https://grantome.com/grant/NIH/R33-CA191198-01
Configurable Primate Units
Transgenic Monkeys

"— Lentivirus-based transgenic cynomolgus monkeys (Macaca fascicularis) expressing human MeCP2 in the brain exhibit autism-like behaviours and show germline transmission of the transgene."

Liu, Z., Li, X., Zhang, J.-T., Cai, Y.-J., Cheng, T.-L., Cheng, C., Wang, Y., Zhang, C.-C., Nie, Y.-H., Chen, Z.-F., Bian, W.-J., Zhang, L., Xiao, J., Lu, B., Zhang, Y.-F., Zhang, X.-D., Sang, X., Wu, J.-J., Xu, X., … Qiu, Z. (2016). Autism-like behaviours and germline transmission in transgenic monkeys overexpressing MeCP2. Nature, 530(7588), 98–102. https://doi.org/10.1038/nature16533
Brain Implant Systems
RatHat

"— Here we present a new stereotaxic method that improves on traditional approaches by reducing costs, training, surgical time, and aiding repeatability. The RatHat brain implantation system is a 3D printable stereotaxic device for rats that is fabricated prior to surgery and fits to the shape of the skull. "

Allen, L. M., Jayachandran, M., Viena, T. D., Su, M., & Allen, T. A. (2019). RatHat: A self-targeting printable brain implant system. BioRxiv, 868422. https://doi.org/10.1101/868422
Body Grow Sacks
Exogenic Pancreas Cloned Pigs

"— The feasibility of blastocyst complementation using cloned porcine embryos allows experimentation toward the in vivo generation of functional organs from xenogenic pluripotent stem cells in large animals."

Liu, Z., Li, X., Zhang, J.-T., Cai, Y.-J., Cheng, T.-L., Cheng, C., Wang, Y., Zhang, C.-C., Nie, Y.-H., Chen, Z.-F., Bian, W.-J., Zhang, L., Xiao, J., Lu, B., Zhang, Y.-F., Zhang, X.-D., Sang, X., Wu, J.-J., Xu, X., … Qiu, Z. (2016). Autism-like behaviours and germline transmission in transgenic monkeys overexpressing MeCP2. Nature, 530(7588), 98–102. https://doi.org/10.1038/nature16533

Emotional Neuroscience

"The intrinsic nature of basic emotional systems has been remarkably well conserved during the course of mamalian evolution."

Jaak Pansepp. Affective Neuroscience (2004)
